repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Yesterday was trying to prevent the jumplist from being saved in the shada file, as I've been for ages experiencing what is basically #31890. I first tried to remove the `'` item from `'shada'`, as `:h shada-'` says "Including this item also means that the jumplist and the changelist are stored in the shada file.". But then I got an error because of "This parameter must always be included when 'shada' is non-empty.". Together these two sentences are confusing, and effectively mean that you can't prevent the jumplist and changelist from being stored in the shada file. I also tried `'0` which as expected stopped local marks from being saved, but not the jumplist.

I took a look at the code and it seemed quite straighforward to fix the problem - just add a check to not call `shada_init_jumps` if `'0` is in `'shada'`.

While testing I found and fixed three more issues with `shada_write`:
- `/0` doesn't prevent saving the previous search and substitute patterns, directly contradicting `:h shada-/`
- If there is no previous `:s` replacement string, a empty zero-timestamp shada item is stored 
- `f0` correctly prevents saving global marks, except for the `'0` mark which is always saved

So with this I can now use `'0` to stop storing the jumplist in the shada file. This works for me because I also don't care for storing marks, but I think it is a valid usecase to be able to store local marks (and `v:oldfiles`) but not the jumplist. Local marks are buffer-local and the jumplist is window-local (and the shada file also only stores the jumplist of the current window), so imo the jumplist should get its own `'shada'` item, `j` makes the most sense to me.

Fixes #33511
Fixes #31890
Related #5078

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    if (sub.sub != NULL) {  // Don't store empty replacement string.
```

```suggestion
  it("restores global and numbered marks even with `'0` and `f0` in shada", function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -51,29 +51,115 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     eq(2, nvim_current_line())
   end)
 
-  it('does not dump global mark with `f0` in shada', function()
+  it('is able to dump and read back numbered marks', function()
+    local function move(cmd)
+      feed(cmd)
+      nvim_command('wshada')
+    end
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    move('l')
+    move('l')
+    move('j')
+    move('l')
+    move('l')
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename_2)
+    move('l')
+    move('l')
+    move('j')
+    move('l')
+    move('l')
+    -- we have now populated marks 0 through 9
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    feed('gg0')
+    -- during shada save on exit, mark 0 will become the current position,
+    -- 9 will be removed, and all other marks shifted
+    expect_exit(nvim_command, 'qall')
+    reset()
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
+    nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename_2)
+    local marklist = fn.getmarklist()
+    for _, mark in ipairs(marklist) do
+      mark.file = fn.fnamemodify(mark.file, ':t')
+    end
+    eq({
+      {
+        file = testfilename,
+        mark = "'0",
+        pos = { 1, 1, 1, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename_2,
+        mark = "'1",
+        pos = { 2, 2, 5, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename_2,
+        mark = "'2",
+        pos = { 2, 2, 4, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename_2,
+        mark = "'3",
+        pos = { 2, 2, 3, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename_2,
+        mark = "'4",
+        pos = { 2, 1, 3, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename_2,
+        mark = "'5",
+        pos = { 2, 1, 2, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename,
+        mark = "'6",
+        pos = { 1, 2, 5, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename,
+        mark = "'7",
+        pos = { 1, 2, 4, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename,
+        mark = "'8",
+        pos = { 1, 2, 3, 0 },
+      },
+      {
+        file = testfilename,
+        mark = "'9",
+        pos = { 1, 1, 3, 0 },
+      },
+    }, marklist)
+  end)
+
+  it('does not dump global or numbered mark with `f0` in shada', function()
     nvim_command('set shada+=f0')
     nvim_command('edit ' .. testfilename)
     nvim_command('mark A')
     nvim_command('2')
-    nvim_command('kB')
     nvim_command('wshada')
     reset()
     nvim_command('language C')
     eq('Vim(normal):E20: Mark not set', exc_exec('normal! `A'))
+    eq('Vim(normal):E20: Mark not set', exc_exec('normal! `0'))
   end)
 
-  it("does read back global mark even with `'0` and `f0` in shada", function()
+  it("does read back global and numbered mark even with `'0` and `f0` in shada", function()


comment_regular_data.body:
Also, `:h 'shada'` isn't particularly clear on how most of the options control what is saved and what is read from the shada file. From what I can tell, everything but the changelist, buffer list and global variables are always read from the shada file even if they are disabled in `'shada'`. In my case, to actually remove all the jump items from the shada file and stop them from being restored, I had to use `:wshada!`.

I think the most reasonable way to handle this would be to save and restore everything "symmetrically" using `'shada'`, e.g. if `/0` is in `'shada'` then don't save or restore search history or search/sub patterns. But when merging into an existing shada file, everything in it should be preserved, so in this scenario the existing search history and search/sub patterns shouldn't be removed, unless you use `:wsh!`. Doing a merge this way allows for two instances to have different `'shada'` options without having them interfere with each other.
Thank you for giving attention to this. At a glance this looks in good shape, but please give us some time and keep it rebased every week or so (that also notifies us that it's still active).

Although this is fixing bugs, it's significant enough to mention it in `:help news`. What's a 1-sentence description?

> imo the jumplist should get its own `'shada'` item, `j` makes the most sense to me.

That isn't implemented here, right?

> when merging into an existing shada file, everything in it should be preserved, so in this scenario the existing search history and search/sub patterns shouldn't be removed, unless you use `:wsh!`. Doing a merge this way allows for two instances to have different `'shada'` options without having them interfere with each other.

That would be a welcome improvement. Note that https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/5078#issuecomment-233182574 suggested `:keepjumps keeppatterns rshada` as a possible opt-in interface.

> Although this is fixing bugs, it's significant enough to mention it in `:help news`. What's a 1-sentence description?

For the entire PR? The jumplist issue one could argue is _technically_ a new feature since it's not explicitly supported in `:h shada-'`, which is why I made it a 'feat'. For just that I'd give a description of `Setting "'0" in 'shada' now prevents storing the jumplist in the shada file.`. For the whole PR I'd say `Shada file saving now correctly respects "'0", "/0" and "f0" in 'shada'`.

Should I add this myself (and where should I do that), or will you?

> > imo the jumplist should get its own `'shada'` item, `j` makes the most sense to me.
> 
> That isn't implemented here, right?

Nope. It should be a straightforward change, let me know if I should make a PR.

> > when merging into an existing shada file, everything in it should be preserved, so in this scenario the existing search history and search/sub patterns shouldn't be removed, unless you use `:wsh!`. Doing a merge this way allows for two instances to have different `'shada'` options without having them interfere with each other.
> 
> That would be a welcome improvement. Note that [#5078 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/5078#issuecomment-233182574) suggested `:keepjumps keeppatterns rshada` as a possible opt-in interface.

Cool, I can work on that. And `:keepjumps` and `:keeppatterns` would then be effectively the same as temporarily setting `'0` and `/0` respectively.

> Nope. It should be a straightforward change, let me know if I should make a PR.

Not sure how much demand there is for it, so maybe create an issue if there isn't one already.

title: Shada saving improvements
